summary: Email from an Assistant United States Attorney to defense counsel regarding the filing of redacted legal documents in the Ghislaine Maxwell case, specifically concerning birth certificates, GX-52, and a motion to quash. It outlines a proposed procedural schedule for the filings.

persons.name: Christian Everdell

persons.name: Judge Nathan
persons.context: Referenced in the title of an attached document (a letter to the judge regarding birth certificates).

events.title: Coordination on Document Filings
events.description: Prosecution and defense counsel coordinate via email on the procedure for filing redacted versions of legal briefs concerning birth certificates, GX-52, and a motion to quash in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

keyFacts: The email is from an Assistant U.S. Attorney to Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team (Everdell, Pagliuca, Menninger).
It concerns the filing of redacted legal documents related to birth certificates and exhibit GX-52 in Maxwell's case.
The prosecution states they have no redactions to their motion to quash and believes the defense also proposes no redactions.
A procedural schedule is proposed where the prosecution files first, then the defense responds, with final replies to follow.
The correspondence indicates ongoing pretrial litigation over the admissibility or sealing of sensitive evidence (birth certificates, GX-52).
